dsurround.command.dsdump.success: Dump of %1$s §2succeeded§r.  Data can be found in %2$s
dsurround.command.dsreload.success: Resources reload §2succeeded§r. Examine log for details.
dsurround.command.dsmm.reset.failure: Unable to reset the Music Manager: %1$s
dsurround.config.title: Dynamic Surroundings Configuration Options
dsurround.config.logging.tooltip: Configuration options for modifying diagnostic behavior
dsurround.config.logging.enableDebugLogg: Enables/disables debug logging of the mod
dsurround.config.logging.traceMask.toolt: Bitmask for toggling various debug traces
dsurround.config.logging.enableModUpdate: Enable/disable chat window notification when newer mod versions are available
dsurround.config.logging.filteredTagView: Enable/disable filtering of tags in the diagnostic overlay. If enabled, tag listings will be filtered to only those belonging to loader frameworks as well as Minecraft and this mod. If disabled, all tags will be shown.
dsurround.config.logging.registerCommand: Enable/disable registration of client side commands. Disabling may provide broadest level of support when using the mod with other loaders, such as Quilt.
dsurround.config.soundSystem.tooltip: Configuration options for modifying Minecraft's Sound System behavior
dsurround.config.soundSystem.streamingCh: The number of sound channels to reserve for streaming sounds (music, biome sounds, records, etc.)
dsurround.config.soundSystem.cullInterva: Ticks between culled sound events (0 to disable culling)
dsurround.config.soundSystem.enableSound: Enables/disables cancellation of sound that a player will not hear. Does not apply to global, non-attenuated, or WEATHER sounds.
dsurround.config.soundOptions.tooltip: Options for defining how Dynamic Surroundings generate sound effects
dsurround.config.soundOptions.ambientVol: Ambient sounds played by the mod will be multiplied by this factor. The unit scale is 1/100, so a setting of 100 would multiply by 1. Volume calculations have several different factors, this setting being one of them. Regardless of these factors, the final volume will be restricted to a range of 0.0 - 1.0.
dsurround.config.soundOptions.replaceThu: Enables replacement of thunder sounds with Dynamic Surroundings' version
dsurround.config.soundOptions.allowScary: Enables playing scary sounds. Scary can be subjective. It is up to mod pack authors to implement properly within the configuration. Disliked sounds also be blocked using the in-game sound configuration menu.
dsurround.config.soundOptions.playBiomeM: Enables playing configured biome background music when in creative mode. Normally while in creative mode, Minecraft's situational music selector will automatically pick creative music rather than biome background music.
dsurround.config.soundOptions.displayToa: Enables the display of toast notifications for music that has a requirement for attribution. Please see the CREDITS.md file on Github for details.
dsurround.config.blockEffects.blockEffec: Distance that will be scanned when generating block effects. Changing this setting will cause existing effects to be reset and the area rescanned.
dsurround.config.blockEffects.steamColum: Enable/disable steam column effect when liquids hit hot sources
dsurround.config.blockEffects.flameJetEn: Enable/disable flame jets produced over lava and nether wart
dsurround.config.blockEffects.waterfalls: Enable/disable waterfall effect from flowing water
dsurround.config.blockEffects.enableWate: Enable/disable waterfall sound effects.  Particle effects will still happen if enabled. If you want to turn off waterfalls use the option 'Enable Waterfall Sounds'.
Enable/disable particles from waterfalls. Sound effects will still happen if enabled. If you want to turn off waterfalls use the option 'Enable Waterfall Sounds'.
dsurround.config.blockEffects.waterRippl: The style of water ripple to render when a drop hits a fluid. Commonly happens with rainfall and water splashes.
dsurround.config.entityEffects.entityEff: The maximum range at which entity special effects are applied. Keep in mind that sound and particle effects have their own respective ranges within the Minecraft game engine.
dsurround.config.entityEffects.enableBre: Enable/disable breath effect in cold biomes
dsurround.config.entityEffects.enableSwi: Enable/disable item swing sound effects from players and mobs
dsurround.config.entityEffects.enableBru: Enable/disable sound effect when walking through dense brush
dsurround.config.footstepAccents.tooltip: Configuration options for footstep accent effects
dsurround.config.footstepAccents.enableA: Enable/disable accents for armor that is worn
dsurround.config.footstepAccents.enableW: Enable/disable accents for when it is raining or blocks are waterlogged
dsurround.config.footstepAccents.enableF: Enable/disable accents for when the player is walking on squeaky blocks
dsurround.config.footstepAccents.enableL: Enable/disable accents for when the player is walking on leafy blocks
dsurround.config.particleTweaks.tooltip: Configuration options for tweaking particle behavior
dsurround.config.particleTweaks.suppress: Enable/disable suppressing the current players potion particles when in first person view
Enable/disable showing of projectile particle trails on critical strikes
Configuration options for the compass and clock overlay
Enable/disable display of the clock display when holding a clock item. The time information will be displayed above the hot bar.
Enable/disable display of the compass display when holding a compass item. Compass heading will be displayed above the crosshair.
Scales the compass rendering by the specified amount
dsurround.config.enhancedSounds.tooltip: Configuration options for enhanced sound processing (reverb, etc.)
dsurround.config.enhancedSounds.enableEn: Enable/disable enhanced sound processing (reverb, occlusion, etc)
dsurround.config.enhancedSounds.enableMo: Enable/disable on the fly conversion of stereo sounds to mono as needed. This function will only be active when 'Enhanced Sound Processing' is enabled.
dsurround.config.enhancedSounds.backgrou: Number of background threads to use for enhanced sound processing. Do not arbitrarily change this value because it could impact performance.
dsurround.config.enhancedSounds.enableOc: Enable/disable sound occlusion processing (sound muffling behind blocks). Enabling will cause additional processing by the background workers, and on lower end computer systems may cause performance issues.
dsurround.config.enhancedSounds.reverbRa: The number of rays to project from a sound location when calculating a reverb effect. Higher values increases CPU use and improves fidelity. Lower numbers reduce CPU and decreases fidelity. This would be the primary setting to tweak when managing performance.
dsurround.config.enhancedSounds.reverbBo: The maximum number of reflections that will be made for a given reverb ray. Higher values will increase CPU use and improves fidelity. Lower numbers reduce CPU and decreases fidelity.
dsurround.config.enhancedSounds.reverbRa: Total distance, in blocks, that a ray will travel when calculating reverb. Higher values will increases CPU use and improves fidelity. Lower numbers reduce CPU and decreases fidelity.
dsurround.config.otherOptions.playRandom: Enable/disable playing random sound at the Minecraft finish loading to main screen
dsurround.text.soundconfig.subtitle: Subtitle:
dsurround.text.soundconfig.cull.help: Enabling Cull will limit the number of plays with the same resource ID from queueing over a short period of time, reducing the overall load of the sound engine as well as ears. Useful around mob farms. Will only apply to sounds played through the Minecraft sound engine.
dsurround.text.soundconfig.block.help: Enabling Block will prevent sounds with the resource ID from playing. Blocking also applies to Dynamic Surrounding sounds. Will only apply to sounds played through the Minecraft sound engine.
dsurround.text.soundconfig.play.help: Play the sound with the volume scaled by the volume scaling factor. Does not apply sound category volume modifiers.
dsurround.text.soundconfig.volume.help: Volume scaling factor applied when calculating the output volume of a sound. Increase to make quiet sounds louder; reduce to make loud sounds quieter. 100% is normal volume.
dsurround.text.config.soundconfiguration: Configure individual sounds within the modpack
dsurround.text.toast.music.title: Music "%1$s"
dsurround.text.toast.music.author: by %1$s
